title: AMS Digital multi-page marketing site with success-story led narrative

requirements.summary: Add client-side routing and dedicated pages for all specified AMS Digital paths, including one route per service detail URL.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigating directly to each route (browser refresh) renders the correct page without a blank screen
Header and footer appear consistently across all pages
Service detail routes exist for every service URL in the user’s list and do not 404

file_operations.description: Replace the current single-page section composition with a routed app shell that renders a dedicated page for each required path and keeps SiteHeader/SiteFooter consistent across routes.

Define and export the route configuration for /, /about, /portfolio (+ case study detail), /blogs, /contact, /customer-reviews, /cookie-policy, /privacy-policy, /amsdigital-profile, /services, plus explicit /services/<slug> routes for every provided service URL.

Create the Home page component rendered at /, structured for success-story-first marketing content and using shared content data modules (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).
Create the /about page using English-adapted copy sourced from the referenced AMS Digital About URL.
Create the /portfolio page to list case studies from centralized data and link into a case study detail view (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).
Create the case study detail view (e.g., /portfolio/:slug) used to display problem/approach/outcome and visuals for each case study.
Create the /blogs page using English-adapted blog listing content sourced from the referenced AMS Digital Blogs URL.

Create the /contact page with a functional contact form UI (client-side submission behavior only) and clear contact details/consultation CTA (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).
Create the /customer-reviews page to render multiple testimonial entries from centralized data and emphasize outcomes.
Create the /privacy-policy page as a dedicated readable legal layout driven by centralized policy content data.
Create the /cookie-policy page as a dedicated readable legal layout driven by centralized policy content data.
Create the /amsdigital-profile page using English-adapted copy sourced from the referenced AMS Digital profile URL.
Create the /services landing page that lists and links to every service detail page, driven by centralized services data (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).
Create the service detail page renderer used by explicit /services/<slug> routes; reads the requested service by slug and displays the required sections plus a Contact CTA.

requirements.summary: Refocus the Home page and global messaging to prioritize client outcomes and route primary CTAs to case studies and consultation.
acceptanceCriteria: Home page hero and at least one additional section explicitly emphasize outcomes/results for clients (not just capabilities)
Primary CTA(s) include a path to Portfolio/Case Studies and a path to Contact/Consultation
Services are presented as supporting the success stories rather than being the sole focus

file_operations.description: Update Home hero and key sections so success stories/outcomes lead the narrative; ensure primary CTA buttons navigate to /portfolio and /contact (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).

Update header messaging/CTAs so the primary actions route to /portfolio (case studies) and /contact (consultation) instead of only in-page scrolling (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).
Centralize global success-story-led messaging (taglines, CTA labels, proof points) so Home and nav CTAs can be updated without editing multiple components.

requirements.summary: Implement a Portfolio/Case Studies experience derived from the provided AMS Digital portfolio source, including list/grid and detail views with visuals and outcomes.
acceptanceCriteria: /portfolio displays multiple case studies derived from the referenced portfolio source (adapted into English as needed)
Each case study can be opened to a detail view that includes a clear outcome/results section
Case studies include at least one visual per item (thumbnail and/or header image) loaded from static assets

file_operations.description: Create maintainable case study data adapted from https://www.amsdigital.in/portfolio.php, including slug, title, industry/client summary, problem/approach/outcome, and references to static thumbnail/hero assets.

Render a case study grid/list from centralized caseStudies data, including consistent thumbnail treatment and links to each detail view (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).
Render case study details (problem/approach/outcome) and supporting visuals loaded from static assets; emphasize outcomes and readability.
Create a reusable case study card component for consistent grid presentation across breakpoints (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).

requirements.summary: Create a Services landing page and individual service detail pages for all provided service URLs, each with required sections and Contact CTA.
acceptanceCriteria: /services lists all services and links to every service detail page
Each service detail page includes an outcomes/results section and a prominent Contact CTA
No service URL from the user’s list is missing from the site navigation paths

file_operations.description: Create centralized services data for every provided service URL (slug aligned to the URL path) including overview, deliverables, process/approach, typical outcomes, and CTA metadata.
Render the full services list/grid driven by services data and link to each explicit /services/<slug> detail route (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).
Render a service detail page that includes overview, key deliverables, process/approach, typical outcomes, and a prominent CTA that routes to /contact.
Ensure there is a distinct route entry for each service slug from the provided URL list (not missing any), wiring each path to ServiceDetailPage.

requirements.summary: Create dedicated About, Blogs, Contact, Customer Reviews, and AMS Digital Profile pages with English copy adapted from the provided URLs.
acceptanceCriteria: Each of the listed routes renders a complete page (not placeholder-only) with coherent English content
Customer Reviews page contains multiple review/testimonial entries and highlights client outcomes where possible
Contact page includes a functional contact form UI and clear contact details/CTA (submission can be non-emailing if no email integration exists)

file_operations.description: Centralize testimonials/reviews adapted from https://www.amsdigital.in/customer-reviews.php, including outcome-oriented highlights.
Centralize blog listing content adapted from https://www.amsdigital.in/blogs.php (English), suitable for rendering as cards/list items.
Centralize English-adapted copy for About and AMS Digital Profile pages sourced from their respective AMS Digital URLs.
Render About page content from centralized companyPages data using consistent section layout and typography.
Render Blogs page content from centralized blogPosts data using a readable, premium list/grid (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).
Render multiple testimonials from centralized reviews data, highlighting outcomes and credibility signals (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).
Render AMS Digital Profile page content from centralized companyPages data in English.

Implement a contact form UI (name/email/message/services interest) with client-side validation and a non-emailing submission confirmation state (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).

requirements.summary: Add dedicated /privacy-policy and /cookie-policy pages and wire footer links to route to them.
acceptanceCriteria: /privacy-policy renders privacy policy content in a readable legal layout
/cookie-policy renders cookie policy content in a readable legal layout
Footer legal links navigate to these routes (not #privacy/#cookies anchors)

file_operations.description: Centralize privacy and cookie policy content (English) adapted from the referenced AMS Digital URLs for rendering in dedicated pages.
Render privacy policy content from legalPolicies data in a readable legal layout (typography, headings, lists).
Render cookie policy content from legalPolicies data in a readable legal layout (typography, headings, lists).
Update Legal links so they navigate to /privacy-policy and /cookie-policy routes (and remove reliance on #privacy/#cookies anchors) (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).
Remove the in-homepage legal anchor section to avoid conflicting with dedicated legal routes and footer route links.

requirements.summary: Update global header and footer navigation to support the multi-page structure with consistent desktop and mobile menus.
acceptanceCriteria: Header nav links route to the correct pages (and do not rely on single-page section scrolling for primary navigation)
Mobile menu includes the same primary destinations as desktop
Footer link groups include working links for Services, Company, and Legal pages

file_operations.description: Replace section-scroll navigation with route navigation links to Home, About, Services, Portfolio, Blogs, Customer Reviews, and Contact; ensure mobile Sheet menu matches desktop items (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).

Update footer link groups so Services and Company links route to the correct pages (e.g., /services, /about, /portfolio, /contact) and Legal links route to dedicated legal pages (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).
Ensure the routed layout consistently wraps all pages with SiteHeader/SiteFooter so navigation remains consistent site-wide.

requirements.summary: Centralize case studies, services, blog posts, and reviews into typed TypeScript data modules and render pages from those modules.
acceptanceCriteria: Portfolio, Services, Blogs, and Reviews pages are driven primarily by shared data structures
Content is easy to update without editing multiple components
TypeScript types exist for core content entities (case study, service, blog post, review)

file_operations.description: Add TypeScript types for core content entities (CaseStudy, Service, BlogPost, Review) to standardize data modules and page rendering.
Ensure caseStudies data is typed and structured for list + detail views, including visual asset references.
Ensure services data is typed and includes all required detail sections for each service page.
Ensure blog post data is typed and renderable without hard-coded blocks inside page components.
Ensure reviews data is typed and supports multiple testimonials with outcome highlights.
Refactor Portfolio page so it renders primarily from centralized typed data (avoid large hard-coded text blocks).
Refactor Services landing page so it renders primarily from centralized typed services data (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).
Refactor Blogs page so it renders primarily from centralized typed blog data.
Refactor Reviews page so it renders primarily from centralized typed reviews data.

requirements.summary: Apply a cohesive modern agency theme (non blue/purple-dominant) with consistent typography, spacing, and premium portfolio presentation across pages.
acceptanceCriteria: All pages share a consistent design system (headings, body text, cards, buttons, sections)
The chosen palette is not primarily blue/purple
Portfolio/case study pages look visually premium and emphasize readability and outcomes

file_operations.description: Extend the existing global design tokens/utilities to support consistent multi-page layouts (page headers, breadcrumb/metadata patterns, premium case study typography) while keeping a non blue/purple-dominant palette.
Create a reusable page layout wrapper to standardize spacing, max-width, page titles, and section rhythm across all new routes (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).
Apply a premium, readability-first case study listing layout with consistent card styling and clear outcome emphasis (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).
Apply premium case study detail styling (typography scale, sections, outcome callouts) consistent with the overall theme (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).

requirements.summary: Add required generated images as static assets and use them on Home and Portfolio (hero visual and case study thumbnails), plus service icon sprite usage.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist in frontend/public/assets/generated with the specified filenames
Home and Portfolio pages load these images directly from static assets (not via backend)
Case study listings display a consistent thumbnail treatment across breakpoints

file_operations.description: Add the generated image asset file required for the Home page hero visual.
Add the generated image asset file required as the consistent case study thumbnail set source.
Add the generated services outline icon sprite for consistent service iconography.

Wire frontend/public/assets/generated/ams-hero-visual.dim_1600x900.png into the Home hero area and ensure it supports responsive layouts (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).

Render case study thumbnails using frontend/public/assets/generated/ams-case-thumb-set.dim_1200x800.png with a consistent treatment across breakpoints (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).

Create a small icon renderer that references frontend/public/assets/generated/ams-services-icons-sprite.dim_1024x1024.png for consistent service icons across Services pages (Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).
